lexUnit.name: stoop.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: bend one's head or body forwards and downwards, or have the head and shoulders habitually bent forwards.

sentence.text: Although she was not a tall woman , she had to stoop low to get through the doorway .
Pardew -- a free transfer from Crystal Palace last season -- stooped low to nod the ball over the line .
As she stooped lower her breath , caught in all the black veils , smelled terrible .
He stooped a couple of times to shift a sheet of corrugated iron or warped plasterboard , but did n't find anything .
She whispered to her husband , as Marion stooped gracefully into the hut , ` Did you ever see such beauty ?
Setting it down on the bedside table , she stooped over George .
He stooped over it , peering down .
` The Blood of Christ , " Peter said softly , stooping to her with the chalice .
He stuck the sheathed knife in his belt and stooped quickly to the old man 's wrists .
He stooped gracefully towards the little man and laughed loud and shyly .
In his enthusiasm he lost his cap and when Beth stooped with difficulty to retrieve it , she almost lost her balance as he insisted on pulling her forward .
47th minute : Arsenal skipper Tony Adams was unlucky to earn a booking for dangerous play as Durie stooped for a header .
But I stooped like lightning and got the nail up and into my skirt pocket -- specially put on -- and I was standing exactly as he left me when he jumped back .
Then she stoops for some pebbles and warns that I 'd better come in now .
Then she stooped with a broad smile to address Emily .
Diana and Charles stooped down to search through the clothes .
He stooped down and reached out a hand towards the hovering coin .
I stooped down to put my face level with his .
He stooped over the sweet peas and examined them .
Lucy Lane , trying to make contact , got up and stooped over the dog , stroking his head .
Pringle looked up at Alan Markby stooping down beside him .
The robe had tripped me each time I had stooped low enough to exert sufficient force , so I had taken it off .
Folly stooped quickly and picked it up .
She stooped rather stiffly to offer the boy her cheek .
He stooped and picked up the torn halves himself .
She got up and stooped to reach the tap .
The students then stoop to sit on their heels and issue another formal bow before standing and beginning the lesson .
